summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 between FBI National Press Office personnel and CBS News 60 Minutes producers regarding an upcoming story on Jeffrey Epstein's death. The FBI personnel discuss maintaining a 'no comment' stance, while the producers request an off-the-record briefing or answers to specific questions about the investigation into Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

keyFacts: CBS News 60 Minutes was preparing a story in January 2020 with 'new information that has not been made public to date' regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The producers asked the FBI to confirm or deny if the Tier L camera(s) viewing Epstein's cell door were not functioning on the night of his death and if they were sent to the FBI lab for examination.

The email reveals questions about whether federal investigators had interviewed correctional officers Michael Thomas and Tova Noel about discovering Epstein's body, noting a federal case was ongoing against them.
The FBI National Press Office personnel internally advocated for maintaining a 'no comment' stance and not providing an off-the-record briefing to 60 Minutes.
A forwarded link references a 2008 FBI report indicating Epstein provided information to the FBI, which contributed to the closure of a federal probe into him.
